Let's not filter by facing mode, just do as I mentioned - dropdown should list all possible cameras; when user opens up the preview modal to take a picture, it should be defaulting to the preferred camera (assuming user has picked one before and it's in cache).

activity.text:
> > @Naman-45 Can you wire this popup to the existing "View all" button instead of a new Full View button? In the overview table, fetch records only from the active statuses and display first. Along with it, fire an API for inactive statuses with limit 0, to decide if "View all" button needs to be displayed or not. On click can open up the new Popup. Let me know if you need any clarifications.
> > Here is an image for reference (Credits: @AdityaJ2305 ). This would also fix #11184 ![image](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/37619282/420856703-56779fd2-62c1-4245-bd29-75683d7d7221.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..gxo1ULo_JLbCBPp7IMsaZNgD1SmC1AS-KxYnqdjdkwg)
> 
> Ok so I will remove Full View button and instead wire it up to the view all button? Now, as you said that you want to display all the active entries in the overview section so what all encounter statuses do we consider as active and which all as inactive statuses.
> 
> And In the overview section as we want to display all the active entries then what if there are more than 14 i.e; cannot be fetched in a single call, how should I handle that case?



> > @Naman-45 Can you wire this popup to the existing "View all" button instead of a new Full View button? In the overview table, fetch records only from the active statuses and display first. Along with it, fire an API for inactive statuses with limit 0, to decide if "View all" button needs to be displayed or not. On click can open up the new Popup. Let me know if you need any clarifications.
> > Here is an image for reference (Credits: @AdityaJ2305 ). This would also fix #11184 ![image](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/37619282/420856703-56779fd2-62c1-4245-bd29-75683d7d7221.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..gxo1ULo_JLbCBPp7IMsaZNgD1SmC1AS-KxYnqdjdkwg)
> 
> Ok so I will remove Full View button and instead wire it up to the view all button? Now, as you said that you want to display all the active entries in the overview section so what all encounter statuses do we consider as active and which all as inactive statuses.
> 
> And In the overview section as we want to display all the active entries then what if there are more than 14 i.e; cannot be fetched in a single call, how should I handle that case?

Symptom and Diagnosis
- show everything else except:
   - clinical status: inactive, resolved
   - verification status: entered in error

Allergy
- show everything else except:
   - clinical status: inactive, resolved
   - verification status: entered in error

As for more than 14 entries, it's fine. Let's just show the default number of entries (14).

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11156
activity.text:
Please do not create broad issues like these.

- We already have a global API error handler; there's a few instances where they are handled manually, but that's being taken care of.
- Let's not do that, schemas are specific to each form, it doesn't make sense to make them resuable
- Offline support needs to be handled broadly, but we have planned a GSOC project for that
- We already have reusable components for loading (Skeleton for cards and Loading for general scenarios)
- Responsiveness, there's already a few issues tackling this for mobile optimization
- Debounce: We already have debounce support and it's being used in searches
- Intl support: Translations are missing in some of the components, but we are slowly adding them with each issue.

I'd suggest looking for smaller issues that you can get started with üëç

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#10706
activity.text:
This is by design.

(1) Multiple patients maybe registered under one number (for example: one number for members of a household)
(2) Phone numbers are unique (compared to names, which are more common) so this isn't solving an issue from efficiency perspective
(3) User should have know patient's number and year of birth to gain basic access (in this case, to create an appointment or an encounter via the search).

We will be introducing permissions to restrict further access (since we are dealing with healthcare data, the whole idea maintain restricted level access).

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#10466
activity.text: > [@Jacobjeevan](https://github.com/Jacobjeevan) could you share more context of the problem? AlertDialogAction is used multiple times across the code base, as part of the AlertDialog component. However, in a few of the instances, styles are manually specified/overridden through tailwind classes. We want to replace those overrides with buttonVariants instead, called through cn function: You can check variants at src/components/ui/button.tsx to check which variant is most applicable (in most cases, it will be destructive, but test and compare with current behavior and new behavior).

> [@rithviknishad](https://github.com/rithviknishad) I think it is a state management issue as when I am continuously changing values, it is showing anonymous behavior. Sometimes the wrong value is getting replaced by the random values between 1-31 for days and 1-12 for months. There may be some other issue also which I am missing. I am working on it.

date-field is expecting user to type in 2 digit values for month (handleMonthChange doesn't change anything if there's only one digit).

To fix this, you can modify the logic in handleMonthChange to pad newMonth before the conditional checks. Also given that form doesn't allow submission when month > 12 (barring the padding issue above), I don't think any additional error handling is needed.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#9814
activity.text:
> @Jacobjeevan I've implemented the changes, but I'm still experiencing an issue where I need to click twice on either the 'Combine PDF' or 'Upload File' options. Could you please confirm if this issue is occurring on your side as well?
> 
> If it‚Äôs not an isolated issue and is happening globally, it might be related to how useState is being used inside the onSelect handler. I haven't been able to pinpoint the exact cause yet. It would be greatly appreciated if you could share any insights on how to fix this, as I plan to address it as soon as possible.

I think the issue is due to to component lifecycle and how it handles hook recreation - when isPdf changed, hook is recreated, but the component is also re-rendered (I'm assuming there's some issue with event handling/file input going on at this stage).

A cleaner approach would be to create a checkbox option within the existing dialog box and then pass it as a variable to fileupload.handleFileUpload, while maintaining the state only within FileUploadDialog component.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#9313
activity.text:
> ![image](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/57055998/394767352-8fe77af8-d2eb-4525-b98f-672a1c5d7819.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..1PnuTIBRtxuGn6p0oBMuW5jZETRGVDJ_EFHz9xqCx7Y)
> 
>     * as per the issue, the value in the screenshot shouldn't be a normal value for bot field, look into it ?
> 
> 
> ![image](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/57055998/394767865-7fa67bce-5776-4734-bf57-6b8708e9777b.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..SCSw1ViJiatbSJM2eF6KDFPtgtGneki3fYMYYs_qUsc)
> 
>     * add the unit in the view page of detailed log update, since its hard to understand what was the user selected unit
> 
>     * the value should be displayed as users entered it, no onversion should be done
> 
>     * make the change in the necessary echarts in the ABG section

(1) So the normal range mentioned in #8859 doesn't map to the range we have for mmHg (after unit conversion).

For mmHg:

Pco2: Low: 10 - 49, Normal: 50 - 199, High: 200 - 400
Po2: Low: 10 - 34, Normal: 35 - 44, High: 45 - 200

But, for kPa, normal range is:

pCO2: 5.1 to 5.6 kPa (~ 38.25 - 42 mmHg)
pO2: 10.5 to 13.5 kPa (~ 78.76 - 101.26 mmHg).

We can specify the units in detail page, but it will always be in mmHg. As for now, we only store the data in mmHg, similar to what we do with temperature. If we want to specifically display the user select unit, we would have to get that added.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#9278
activity.text:
> Only encounter related pages needs checks like these. In patient profile page we can simply check by `patient.is_active` alone.

Well, for a patient who's readmitted, is_active check alone won't suffice. For example:

`Patient A` is discharged from `Facility A` and then readmitted to `Facility B`. If we don't check for facility Id match, a user in Facility A would be able to assign volunteer and view file on the discharged patient.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8480
activity.text:
> Did you try passing a `key` prop to the img. component?

Never mind, I cleared my browser cache/restarted the dev server and it's working (persists across page reload). Only other issue is the change not reflecting on FacilityCard (if the user navigates thru back button or breadcrumb menu instead of reloading).

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8480
activity.text: > I don't see any type errors in `Force-Revalidate: random number as string` method. > > Numbers can't be set as header value. However, number as strings can be. > Ah ok, thanks! Wouldn't this require `Vary: Forced-Revalidate` on S3? Anyways, I tried with `Forced-Revalidate: 1`. But, I'm getting the same result as (2) in my reply above; new image is pulled by the fetch req in the network tab/dev tools, but only reflected on screen if I append a timestamp to the url. Cache doesn't seem to be updated as the change doesn't persist across page reload.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8480
activity.text: > No, you just need to simply send a fetch request to the signed URL of the image with that vary header, so that browser would invalidate it's cache. Therefore leading to the image component to render the new image as the new image is fetched instead of the old cached one. > > Nothing to do with calling any APIs. (1) Couldn't use the fetch + vary method as the HeadersInit type doesn't support it > Type '{ "Forced-Revalidate": number; }' is not assignable to type 'HeadersInit | undefined'. (2) Tried fetch + cache:reload instead. Checking the network tab, it does pull the new version of the image, however I had to append timestamp to have it reflect on page (I tried changing image src directly using getElementById, but that didn't reflect on screen). fetchImage is called on save of the Edit Cover Image Modal/Popup. It doesn't seem to update the cache though, since the change doesn't persist across page reload. https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1077041/refresh-image-with-a-new-one-at-the-same-url/22429796#22429796 mentions few other solutions, including just using timestamp on img src directly, however that would mean storing multiple copies of the same image on cache.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8480
activity.text:
> you'll have to use fetch directly to achieve this since the image url is not a defined api route right? useQuery/request requires an API route to be defined, and the image url is not an API route.

@rithviknishad Oh, I meant moving out the facilityData useQuery to a fetch req (since cover image url is part of that object). Hmm, as for fetching the image url directly, that would require modifications on the backend, right?

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8480
activity.text: @rithviknishad Hmm, since useQuery doesn't support a header parameter, I'd either need to replace it with a fetch outside or modify RequestOptions interface and request function to support header property (preferring the former since it touches less code). Does that sound right, or is there an alternative option?
